item.title: Crime Scene Cleaner: How to Get Perfect Score on Bad Call
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Getting the Perfect Score on Bad Call in Crime Scene Cleaner
  • Cleaning
  • Evidence
  • Bodies

When you're tired of those dark-fantasy Action-RPGs with massive worlds, Crime Scene Cleaner might be the perfect game for you. Offering a fresh take on the simulation genre, this game has you cleaning up bloody crime scenes, disposing of the dead bodies of the victims, gathering all the evidence that the criminal left behind, and also stealing a fair amount of money for yourself.

Bad Call is the first mission in the game. Even though it mostly serves as an introduction to the core mechanics of Crime Scene Cleaner , with helpful tutorials popping up every few minutes, there is a lot that you can miss here if you don't keep a watchful eye. If you manage to clean up the crime scene perfectly, you get awarded with a perfect score for all your efforts.

Getting the Perfect Score on Bad Call in Crime Scene Cleaner

To get a Perfect Score on Bad Call, you’ll need to get perfect scores in three separate sections:

  • Cleaning
  • Evidence
  • Bodies

That means even if you don’t manage to pick up all the secrets and Cassette Tapes hidden around the map, you can still get a perfect score. You also don’t need to find all the money for the 100% completion.

Cleaning

Cleaning in Crime Scene Cleaner refers to three different tasks. First, you'll have to clean the blood stains the criminal has left all over the crime scene. Second, you'll need to return the furniture where it was so there's no sign of a struggle. And finally, you'll need to get rid of all the trash, such as broken glass, plates, or anything else littering the place.

Cleaning the Blood

In Crime Scene Cleaner , the criminals don't really know how to make clean kills. That's where you come in. In the mission Bad Call, there are two main areas where you’ll need to clean the blood: Dealer’s Apartment and The Attic . The Dealer’s Apartment is the section you’ll want to tackle first. Once all the cleaning tasks are done in the apartment section, move on to the Attic.

You’ll need to use the broom for most of the cleaning in Crime Scene Cleaner . However, when cleaning the rag in the dining area or the canvas in the final room in the Attic, using the Sponge is a better idea. Once your broom or sponge is filled with blood, you need to take it back to the bucket and wring it out before you start cleaning again.

The objective marker on the top left of the screen will show how much of the blood there’s still left to clean. Once all the blood is cleaned up, the task will get marked off. Use your Cleaner’s Sense (Q) from time to time to see if there are still any blood stains left on the area.

The washroom in the Dealer’s Apartment is located in the second room on your right. When cleaning the Attic, you can use the faucet in the room with all the marijuana plants.

Putting the Furniture Back

The Dealer’s Apartment has a lot of furniture and items that you’ll have to put back into place. There’s a guitar, a hookah pipe, two tables, two chairs, a bong, and three paintings that you’ll have to put back into place. Also, make sure you put the sofa and chair cushions back in place after wiping off the blood stains.

Getting Rid of the Trash

For the third part of cleaning, you need to pick up all the broken pieces of glass and other junk in the location. You’ll first encounter this task in the dining area of the Dealer’s Apartment, where you’ll find broken pieces of plate all over the floor. Hold the Tab button on your keyboard to bring up your Tool Wheel and select your trash bag.

In the final room in the Attic, you’ll also find five blood paintings that you’ll need to break and dispose of in the trash bag, since they will also count towards your perfect score in Crime Scene Cleaner . Once your trash is full, right-click with the trash equipped to pull out the trash bag.

Remember, simply putting the trash in the bag isn’t enough. You’ll also need to take the trash bags to your pickup van when you escape the crime scene.

Evidence

As the one-man crime scene cleanup crew, it’s also your job to get rid of evidence that can incriminate your client. That means you’ll need to find anything that can connect your client to the murders and pick them up. There are nine pieces of evidence that you’ll need to collect: 5 in the Dealer’s Apartment and 4 in the Attic.

Evidence

Area

Where to Find

Dealer’s Phone

Dealer’s Apartment

On the floor in the third room of the Dealer’s Apartment with the Acoustic Guitar and the three wall paintings.

Phone

Dealer’s Apartment

On the cabinet with the record player on top in the fourth room in the Dealer’s Apartment.

Customers List

Dealer’s Apartment

On the window ledge in the kitchen in Dealer’s Apartment.

Knife

Dealer’s Apartment

Stabbed in the back of the victim lying dead in the kitchen in the Dealer’s Apartment.

Cash

Dealer’s Apartment

On the table in the room after the kitchen in the Dealer’s Apartment.

Photos

Attic

Pick up two sets of four photos from the bulletin board in the first room in the Attic.

Camera

Attic

On the table in the last room with the hanging body in the Attic.

Student ID

Attic

In the same room as the Camera camera in the far right corner from the door.

Bodies

There are three bodies that you’ll need to take care of during the Bad Call mission at Crime Scene Cleaner. You don’t have to clean them, but you also can't just hide the bodies anywhere nearby. You'll need to pick them up, take them to the back of your pickup truck, and throw them in the trunk. They’ll automatically get put inside body bags.

  • The first victim’s body is located in the kitchen in the Dealer’s Apartment area. He will have a knife stuck in his back, which you’ll need to collect as crime scene evidence. After that, pick him up and haul him over to your pickup truck to put him away.
  • The next body can be found when you unlock the door to the Attic in the room adjacent to the kitchen. The body drops down the moment you open the door.
  • For the final victim’s body, you’ll need to go to the last room in the Attic. The victim will be hanging in front of a canvas. Hold your left mouse button to pick her up and carry her over to your pickup.

When you’re near the back of your pickup, pressing E will open the trunk, allowing you to jump up on it. Getting up on the back of the pickup makes it easier for you to drop the bodies in the trunk.

Once you’ve completed all the steps discussed above, you can now simply walk to the driver’s seat and interact with it. This will end the mission, and you’ll see the final score that you achieved. If you do all the activities we mentioned, you’ll be rewarded with a perfect score. As a bonus, you’ll also unlock the achievement “Bad Call” in Crime Scene Cleaner .

item.title: New Pokemon TCG Cards Revealed at Pokemon World Championships
item.description:
Highlights

  • The Paradise Dragona set from Pokemon TCG was revealed at 2024 World Championships, including new ex Illustration rare cards like Latios and Latias.
  • The Paradise Dragona set will also feature popular Pokemon like Duraludon and Flygon.

A new set of cards from the upcoming Pokemon TCG set, Paradise Dragona, was revealed at the Pokemon World Championships 2024 tournament. The Pokemon TCG continues to be incredibly popular, whether it be for collectors looking to fill out their collections or a competitive scene that is constantly evolving. The ongoing Pokemon TCG Championships feature some of the best players in the competitive scene looking to become world champion.

The 2024 Pokemon World Championships is taking place in Honolulu, Hawaii, and features some of the best players battling it out in a variety of Pokemon games, including the mainline games, Pokemon TCG , and even Pokemon GO . The event teased various reveals and discussions about all things Pokemon , as The Pokemon Company president Tsunekazu Ishihara teased that Sunday's closing ceremonies would feature "special news" about the Pokemon franchise. In regard to the Pokemon TCG side, four new illustration cards were revealed for the Paradise Dragona expansion.

As reported by PokeBeach, these are four new ex Illustration rare cards that will be a part of the Paradise Dragona Pokemon TCG set. The four Pokemon represented in these illustrations are the double dragon twins Latios and Latios, along with Exeggcute and Alolan Exeggutor. Of the four newly revealed cards, Latias and Alolan Exeggcutor are ex cards, with the Latios and Latias cards being connecting cards that form a bigger picture.

New Illustration Cards Revealed for Paradise Dragona

  • Latios
  • Latias ex
  • Exeggcute
  • Alolan Exeggcutor ex

The Paradise Dragona set will also feature cards of other popular Pokemon, such as Duraludon and its evolved form Archaludon, Trapinch and its final evolution Flygon, and many others. Pokebeach also provided fans with English translations of these upcoming cards and their abilities. The Paradise Dragona set will be released in Japan first on September 13, while the English cards will likely be a part of the Surging Sparks set in November.

The future of Pokemon seems pretty bright, between the various trading card game expansions, spin-offs, anime, and new games in the works. While Ishihara did comment on the Pokemon franchise getting big updates at the end of the World Championships, it's unclear if he was referring to the mainline games or spin-offs like Pokemon GO . The next entry in the long-running franchise is 2025's Pokemon Legends Z-A , which was previously revealed during a Pokemon Presents showcase in February. This game sees players revisiting the Kalos Region and Lumiose City from Pokemon X and Y , though no information aside from its initial teaser trailer has been revealed at this time.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail Leak Shows Scrapped Relics from Closed Beta
item.description:
Highlights

  • Leaks from Honkai: Star Rail are showing a plethora of scrapped Relics originally featured in the second closed beta test for the sci-fi RPG.
  • The leak shows that Relic sets previously featured six different pieces for players to acquire before Planar Ornaments were added to the game.
  • Honkai: Star Rail looks to have plenty of content on the way, including several new characters and a new gameplay mechanic for the Toughness meter.

A new leak from Honkai: Star Rail is showcasing several scrapped Relics originally featured in the game's closed beta test, including their descriptions. The popular sci-fi RPG from HoYoverse features a plethora of different ways for players to power up their characters, with multiple resources to acquire through in-game challenges and the gacha system. Players can pick up new Light Cones from in-game events and through Honkai: Star Rail 's gacha banners or power up their characters' Traces by farming for in-game materials. One method, however, features a wide variety of unique effects and buffs.

Relics are one of the main ways for Honkai: Star Rail players to upgrade their characters, with multiple different Relic sets available. Players can acquire Relics by clearing Honkai: Star Rail 's Cavern of Corrosion challenges, found throughout Star Rail 's in-game worlds and the Herta Space Station. Relics provide bonuses ranging from increases to Physical and Elemental Damage to unique buffs catered towards specific characters' playstyles. Now, leaks are showing a set of scrapped Relics originally featured in the game's second closed beta test.

Honkai: Star Rail Leak Shows Scrapped Beta Relics

A recent leak shared by prominent Honkai: Star Rail leaker Sakura Haven is showing off a plethora of scrapped Relics featured in Star Rail 's beta test. The leak shows fifth and sixth pieces for multiple Honkai: Star Rail Relic sets, including the Musketeer of Wild Wheat, Champion of Streetwise Boxing, and Guard of Wuthering Snow among others. The post also shares more details about the scrapped Relics, with Relic sets originally featuring six pieces during the beta test. The post suggests that Star Rail 's artists typically make test hand-drawn versions before creating new Relics.

The scrapped Relic sets come as fans have uncovered a variety of removed items and different resources from Star Rail in the past. Past leaks have shown everything from older versions of Star Rail 's characters to completely scrapped and reworked cast members. Fans have even discovered unused game mechanics like a "dating sim" mechanic once intended for Honkai: Star Rail , allowing players to build their relationships with their party members.

While fans will likely never see the fifth and sixth pieces of Relic sets, Star Rail 's new updates continue to push new content for the game. Leaks have teased a variety of new characters planned throughout the game's upcoming patches, including highly-anticipated roster members like Sunday and a new variant of Tingyun. Recent rumors have also hinted at a new mechanic for Toughness, featuring a new "Feigned Toughness" meter that players can trigger for extra bonuses. New characters and mechanics look to have plenty of exciting gameplay coming to Honkai: Star Rail in the near future.

item.title: Why Dungeons and Dragons' 2025 Monster Manual is Sitting on a Powder Keg
item.description:
Highlights

  • D&D 2024's Monster Manual aims to address the power imbalance in mid-high CR monsters, making encounters more challenging for players.
  • Every class in D&D 2024 has been given more powerful options, with weapon masteries and feats boosting damage output and longevity.
  • The new Ancient Green Dragon statblock in the upcoming Monster Manual shows a significant increase in damage output to match player power levels.

Dungeons and Dragons ' upcoming 2024 Player's Handbook is only the first among a set of revised core rulebooks. However, the third entry in this series—the remastered Monster Manual , set for a February 2025 release—has been set a mighty task by the design behind Dungeons and Dragons ' 2024 revision.

D&D 5e has often fallen short when it comes to giving mid-high CR monsters their due in terms of raw power. Where DMs can easily fell D&D players in the early game, with the goblins of Phandelver tearing up new players by the dozen, godlike terrors and forces of nature are a cakewalk at their own level. The best spot for D&D is around levels 3-10, where encounters feel like fair fights. Still, even here there are monsters that are far weaker than the CR they're given—despite new books giving players more and more powerful options.

D&D 2024's Monster Manual Needs To Put Up A Fight

Players are tougher than ever before in D&D 2024 's Player's Handbook . Despite some spells being rightfully nerfed, alongside some less obvious nerfs found in D&D 2024 's revised character creation, every class has been given the means to blast more damage, stay in the fight longer, and approach problems with more options. Every player will also be getting a feat from their background, as well as an Epic Boon feat at level 19—cranking power higher at the start and end of player journeys.

Weapon masteries are a big part of this; even D&D 2024 's paladin, which has received a hefty nerf to its smite, is getting itself potent weapon masteries. Some of these masteries simply put out more damage, while others can knock creatures prone without sacrificing damage. A fighter with three attacks and the Topple mastery has three chances to knock a foe prone (six if they use Action Surge), all without sacrificing damage. This definitely helps close the power gap between martials and casters, but it nonetheless puts monsters in a tricky spot.

The New Ancient Green Dragon Statblock Is A Good Sign

Recent D&D monster releases, such as those found in Spelljammer , Planescape , Bigby Presents: Glory of the Giants , and Vecna: Eve of Ruin haven't been up to snuff when it comes to knocking down players. These monsters, while having a great deal of solid design, often pull punches—overweighing defensive abilities to the detriment of damage output. Fortunately, this seems to be changing with D&D 2024 ; not only have designers already stated that the math behind calculating CR is being changed, WOTC designer Makenzie De Armas stated in a recent interview with Ghostfire Gaming's Eldritch Lorecast "Don't worry, the monsters will hit harder" in response to concerns about player power.

The new Ancient Green Dragon statblock, revealed at an official D&D Gencon panel, seems to confirm this. This statblock, which will be part of the upcoming 2025 Monster Manual , is far more dynamic, giving the dragon more to do as well as more health and damage. That damage is particularly important, though: the 2014 Ancient Green Dragon and its 2024 revision are both CR 22 and can make six attacks per round (if they focus out-of-turn abilities on damage), but the total average damage per round (assuming all attacks hit) is 38 points higher in 2024.

The jump from 124 to 162 is incredibly significant, putting the dragon exactly where it should be hitting in terms of damage. Using the encounter-building guidelines of D&D 5e- compatible Flee Mortals , designed using the tried-and-tested Lazy Encounter Benchmark by TTRPG designer Mike Shea, a CR 22 ancient green dragon should be a tough solo encounter for 4-5 players of levels 15-16. Players of this level are far beyond demigod status already, especially spellcasters, so the fact that the new dragon has more bite, more health, and more options is a major boon. If all revised monsters follow this example, they'll definitely keep pace with players.

item.title: Persona 3 Reload Players May Get the Best of Both Worlds with The Answer DLC
item.description:
Highlights

  • Persona 3 Reload fixes the missing epilogue in The Answer, enhancing the definitive edition status.
  • The original version of The Answer had flaws, but Reload may steer clear of controversies.
  • Episode Aigis hints at adding social mechanics to The Answer, improving gameplay experience.

Persona 3 Reload received wide acclaim upon its release and is commonly seen as the new definitive version of Persona 3 . This comes with one caveat, being that the game did not include an epilogue called The Answer, which was introduced in Persona 3 FES . Persona 3 Reload will correct this soon thanks to its upcoming DLC, Episode Aigis: The Answer, which itself seems to be hiding some great news.

Although the original version of The Answer provided a satisfying conclusion for many fans, it certainly isn't without its faults. Remakes have the gift of hindsight, meaning Persona 3 Reload should avoid The Answer's controversies whenever possible. First and foremost, FES ' version of The Answer is a linear dungeon crawl. This is a far cry from the social simulation mechanics that have become synonymous with Persona , but one obscure detail in a recent trailer may hint at Persona 3 Reload 's intention to depart from this design.

The Latest Persona 3 Reload Trailer Shows a Hidden Detail About Episode Aigis: The Answer

The Pros and Cons of The Answer in Persona 3

The Answer is an essential piece of Persona 3 's story, but it's far from sunshine and rainbows. The Answer is fondly remembered among most fans now, but its reception was a much more mixed bag at the time of its release. Adapting The Answer into a modern game such as Persona 3 Reload presents one challenge above all else: The Answer's biggest problem is simply a result of its greatest strength.

The Answer was first introduced in Persona 3 FES , which was the type of expanded re-release that has become increasingly common throughout the Persona series. Although it was certainly satisfying on its own, the ending of Persona 3 's original story left both its characters and players lacking some necessary closure. Thankfully, The Answer was developed in order to provide that closure. Many characters had their arcs completed, and the epilogue earned its reputation as required reading.

Although its reputation has softened significantly over time, The Answer is still remembered for the problems it raised as a consequence of its design. The Answer was designed as a linear dungeon crawl, meaning there are no opportunities for the player to go on extracurricular social outings. This is somewhat necessary thanks to the premise of The Answer, so it was lent the benefit of the doubt. However, when these outings were replaced by frustrating boss fights and a certain degree of grinding, it left some players with a bad taste in their mouths.

Persona 3 Reload May Fix The Answer's Biggest Drawback

There was very little expectation that Episode Aigis: The Answer would do much to overhaul the core design of the original. After all, most criticisms of The Answer's gameplay could be resolved through simple adjustments. Meanwhile, changing its structure from the ground up would be much more demanding and unreasonable to accomplish. Despite this challenge, a recent trailer revealed that developers may intend to do the impossible after all.

Though nothing has been confirmed, Persona 3 Reload 's newest character trailer for Metis signals good news ahead. Eagle-eyed viewers may have noticed what appeared to be a hang-out scene with Metis in the dorm room. This is not only a departure from the original version of The Answer, but an addition altogether. In fact, it may even indicate an effort to reintroduce additional social mechanics to The Answer.

The announcement of Episode Aigis: The Answer was undoubtedly exciting. If Persona 3 Reload is going to truly feel definitive, it needs to deliver on the narrative's epilogue. The highest priority for The Answer should still be concluding the story of the original game, but gameplay will need some polishing as well if players are to have the best experience possible. While dramatic additions seemed unlikely, new information seems to be disproving this notion. Hopefully, Episode Aigis will continue to exceed expectations with future updates.
